clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Effects of Sublingual Sufentanil 30 µg on Postoperative Recovery
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study Assessing the Effects of Sublingual Sufentanil 30 µg on Postoperative Recovery From Ambulatory Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: pilot study to evaluate the effect of incorporating sublingual sufentanil into our perioperative opioid regimen for ambulatory orthopedic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
A pilot study to evaluate the effect of incorporating sublingual sufentanil into our perioperative opioid regimen for ambulatory orthopedic surgery. The results will help us estimate treatment effect and determine sample size for a subsequent full-scale clinical trial.
Primary Endpoint: total amount of fentanyl consumed during hospital admission. Secondary Endpoints: 1) phase I recovery time; and, 2) time to fitness for discharge.
Exploratory Endpoints 1) pain; 2) time to first request for analgesia; and, 3) incidence of nausea and vomiting between the end of anesthesia and hospital discharge.

primary_outcome.description: The total amount of fentanyl consumed after surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: The pain score will be measured as 0-10 Verbal Response Scores conducted at rest. O meaning no pain, and 10 being the worst pain.
The investigator will use the (PONV) Intensity Scale, at intervals will be used, for postoperative nausea and vomiting.

arm_group.description: 30 µg tablet of sublingual sufentanil preoperatively and fentanyl placebo at induction of anesthesia.
placebo sublingual sufentanil preoperatively and 50 µg fentanyl at induction of anesthesia
